title: Well maintained park
review_text: Very well maintained park with children play facilities, memorials, joggers area, garden, etc. Very clean and by the sea.

title: Great Park , decent aquarium
review_text:
The park is a really nice place to chill where you can see the ocean and sit in the park benches. The " I love Port Blair" sign is here and there are some activities for kids here. 

Aquarium costs only Rs 10 to enter. There is a whale skeleton outside. The aquarium has lots of preserved marine species, some corals and some fish. It can be skipped and there isn't too much to see here.

title: Beautiful Park
review_text: This is a beautiful park well maintained, neat, well lit, and they have nicely made this park on the sea. Worth a visit to this place. Especially it was a full moon so it looked even more beautiful than usual.

title: Small but well kepy
review_text: Nothing great,but if you have time one can visit.The park is not big ,but it is well maintained and a stroll in the evening is plesant.

title: Good sports complex
review_text: This place is famous for sports activites. You can take ferry for North bay and Ross island from this place. This is one of the famous place in Port blair.

title: More of a Biology Lab about Marine Lives.
review_text: Expect to see so many fishes, crabs, saw fish, corals, big shells, pearls in clam shells, lobster ,guitar fish some of them dead and some alive. That's it. Took around 20 minutes. Must take 50/rupees tickets for video by phone .. stills are not allowed.

title: Not a must watch but you see it anyways.
review_text: I wont vouch for this place as something special. But you have to come here to go to Ross Island and North Bay, as you get your speedboat from here itself. Nothing great.

title: WORTH A VISIT: AREA NEEDS TO BE CLEANED
review_text:
Visited this place twice when we were in Port Blair recently. This particular park is made on reclaimed land, which is supposed to have been reclaimed by dumping the extra soil got from the evacuation for the construction of the Cellular Jail. The area has been done beautifully and is adjacent to the Rajiv Gandhi Water Sports Complex, the Andaman Water Sports Complex and the Netaji Subhash Bose Stadium. 
In and around the Marina Park is the Statue of Netaji Subhash Chander Bose, the PVC Memorial, the Tsunami Memorial, the Aberdeen Memorial (In honour of the battle of Aberdeen, between the Great Andamanese and the Brits). Unfortunately all the memorials and the area around them need to be maintained and cleaned. The sorry state of the PVC Memorial and the Netaji Memorial is primarily because of people littering the place and sitting all over the memorials. The Army has placed a tank close to the Netaji Memorial. 
There is a clear view of Ross Island visible from this Park. The Marine Aquarium is closer to the Cellular Jail and has a good collection of fish, corals and skeletons of sea creatures. Unfortunately the same is poorly maintained. More

title: Lot of Specimens
review_text: Fisheries Department's Aquarium is located by the side of Water Sports Complex and closed on Wednesday. The daily lunch time is from 1300 hrs to 1400 hrs. Museum has decent specimens of dead marine funa. However, it's 'live aquarium part' is badly managed with sub-optimal collection of live marine fishes. Infact, the aquarium part of Samudrika Naval Museum is far superior then this place. There's a small souvenir shop run by a local self help group at its main Entrance Door; where one can find various gift items made of sea shells. This outlet is one of the cheapest selling joint of such product in Port Blair. Infact, cost of similar items are cheaper here than Government controlled "Sagarika" Selling Outlet. Ofcourse, to get the optimum price one has to use his/her 'Bargaining' skill upto the hilt. Overall, it is worth spending half hour at this Aquarium of Department of Fisheries. More

title: Don't waste time on this!
review_text: Although Port Blair is beautiful, a local trip within Port Blair is not worth it given the high cost of accommodation here! Within Port Blair, only Cellular Jail is worth the time.

title: Aquarium shows a number of fishes, corals and skeleton remains of the area
review_text: The Aquarium is a beautiful and educative destination to be in. It has 3-4 rooms filled with all the biodiversity of sea fishes, corals and other artefacts pertaining to the area inside it. One must definitely pay a visit. Photography is not allowed.

title: Andaman First Resort Tour Travel s
review_text:
It's the water sports area 
Snorkelling Jetskey drive scuba diving etc can do & enjoy a lots 
A real time fun Rs 950 per person 
Love to visit more time....

title: May visit at night if you are in leisure
review_text:
At night the Marina Park of Port Blair is a nice Place for time pass.There is a small canteen at the gate.It's free. Near by Rajib Gandhi water sports complex is also beautiful at night,you may sit and enjoy the breeze from across the sea. 
A children park is there.

title: Fun and frolic
review_text:
Located along the sea,it is the place to visit in the evenings. One can stroll on the walkway or sit on the benches watching the waves. There's a performance by the Police band on some weekends. The women band is unique..... 
The children can play on the swings in the play area or cycle in the traffic park while learning traffic rules. 
There's an open air gym where a lot of youngsters can be seen working out. It is a free WiFi zone also. 
There's a jetty for water sports and some restaurants selling fast food. 
A great place for a family outing.

title: Its a delight
review_text: I stayed near this park, visited here morning and in evenings. It is well within the city and decently crowded at all the times. Water is blue and very clear. The whole park including lightings and cleanliness is very well maintained.

title: Good for sea life lover
review_text:
It is one of the best museum to understand the different type of sea creatures. In it you can see the rearer species of sea. It include skeleton of shark, saw fish and different type of fish, coral etc. 
Photography is not allow.

title: Evening time acivity
review_text: Good to visit in the evening and enjoy sunset. If you are going to Ross and North Bay Islands than you have to catch boat from nearby Rajiv Gandhi Water Sports Complex.

title: Start your trip from here
review_text:
The aquarium gives you a detailed insight to what you encounter at havelock or Neil islands. If you see this before you proceed to the islands your experience will be heightened. 

All the fishes, corals which you encounter are fully explained and you appreciate how rich this island is.

title: Tourist atraction
review_text: Very crowdy in the evenings. Must enjoy ride in Nicobar Hodi. A very nice view in the evening. A boat ride also can be availed

title: Aquarium must visit with kids
review_text:
The Aquarium is well maintained has good collection of fish and other species. Kids will have fun learning here. Adults can have some joy time too here. 

Boats for Ross Island and North Bay leaves from this jetty.

title: Famous jetty for island
review_text: This is one of the famous jetty. There is also sports activity in day time. This place is jetty for Ross island and North Bay island.

title: Worth visiting in Evening
review_text: Please take out time and take a long walk, worth visiting. the India map all illuminated in the back drop, cool winds, beautiful clean park is worth spending time out there

title: leisure
review_text:
this aquarium is not very big but houses several species of fish,turtle. sea is close by.It is well maintained 
nice to spent some time here.children will enjoy this.

title: small aquarium
review_text: Good small aquarium. Few rare species are there. kids will love. Rs 10 entry fee. It is near the jail.

title: Nice view
review_text:
You can easily walk to this park from Aberdeen Bazaar / Clock Tower area. Located adjacent to Rajiv Ghandhi water sports complex. Nice sea view and a view of Ross Island. There is a sea food restaurant - though we did not try it - seems popular with tourists. Good seating. Clean environment. Statue of Nethaji Subash Chandra Bose and a Vijayantha Tank on display. There is a memorial for the heroes who participated in the 1857 national revolution who were 'deported' to Andaman islands. A kids park with some basic play equipment is there. As you walk down the pier you can observe Crabs and sea urchins on the left hand side. The pier is well lit on both sides making it a good place for walk. You can view the map of India with the title I Love India clearly visible all through as it is well lit in the evenings also. 
Nice place to spend a relaxing hour or two. More

title: Relaxing
review_text: Good place to spend your evening. Basically, a family place.There is a restaurant where you get all chatpata food items. Can give it a try.

title: beautiful view
review_text: it is great to spend an evening over here. you love its keep. the park is well maintained. a good place to enjoy

title: Relaxing environment
review_text: This is adjacent to sea Having a small play area of kids. At the evening, ambiance is too good. A place to sit to watch sea, hear its voice and have a cup of tea from inside the park.

title: Nice aquarium
review_text: This is a small aquarium where you may get information about fishes, shells, marine life etc. It is having a section about corals too. Many of the fishes are kept in formaline solution. may be added in itinerary if you have time else may be nicely skipped.

title: Awesome view
review_text:
Marina Park and the aquarium are a great place to hang out in Port Blair. 
Apart from leisurely walking along the sea, one can indulge in water sports. There is a children park also on the Marina along with food joints.A fun place....

title: Exotic tropical sealife on display
review_text: Its a great place to feast your eyes on exotic fishes of the tropical waters. You can typically spend around an hour here. We were amazed by the diversity of sea life on display here. There were restrictions on photography in this place.

title: Nice place
review_text: Nice place for spending leisure time. We came here for 2/3 days in evening. There are a cafeteria. Excellent tea and coffee.. You can get large crab in aquarium for feed if luck favour. Very reasonable rate for cooked crab. Jetty for Ross and Northbay Island also is here. You can book water sports here. We booked boat namly Musafir. They are reliable.

title: Nice park
review_text:
A pretty nice park adjacent to Rajiv Gandhi water sports complex. 
A place to laze around and relax while the children play in the swings etc. 
Has a good cafeteria as well. 
Try out some chicken/prawn pakodas.

title: nice
review_text: we just took a brief halt here to take in the view and a couple of pictures, it was so windy that day. The area is so pretty with a small memorial and the beach and aquarium

title: Marina Park and Aquarium
review_text: A prime attraction located on the unspoiled shores of Port Blair, the Marina Park and Aquarium is a beautiful little establishment aimed at educating the masses about the marine ecosystem. The aquarium contains impressive displays of the endemic marine organisms and marine habitats. Outside this, lies a well laid park that contains many amusement facilities for children and makes for a very nice picnic spot.

title: Ferry place for North Bay and Ross island as well as water sports
review_text: This is the point from where you board the ferry for North Bay, Ross island etc. Also can do water activities such as sea walk, Andaman dolphin etc all of which start from Marina Park.. During evening a lot of locals and tourists come here to chill.. Overall pretty decent place to spend the evening.

title: very good
review_text: different types of fishes we can see here.my child enjoyed this place.even my self enjoyed to see this fishes ans so many sea creatures preserved .

title: My kid loved the fish
review_text:
This is one of the tourist spots of Port Blair where one can see various types of fish and sea life. 
It's spread over an area with aquarium, preserved fish sea lion in jars and other sea creatures. 
One would need about 45 minutes to an hour to see this place. Kids like to see all the creatures and actually enjoy it. 
Overall a decent place.

title: Not very exciting
review_text: Place needs a face life. The lights are dim and the arrangement is not very good. Collection covers several species. The place can be better maintained to make it attractive for the visitors.

title: Glance of the Marine life
review_text: This place is dominated by fishes. You get to see a great variety of fishes from in and around Andaman islands. Apart from fishes, other marine creatures like star fish, molluscs etc. are also seen. Coral structures of different color, shapes are kept on display. Tortoise shells are also portrayed.

title: A Gateaway to Ross Island
review_text: It is a beautiful place close to sea, at the gateway to Ross Island. It is one of the most pleasant place for fresh air, photography and scenic views. A real good place for time pass.

title: Average Place....
review_text: Not great, but still you can visit with large group.You can spend some time and enjoy this aquarium.Kid will really nice time.

title: Good collection
review_text: You get to see a variety of fishes and other aquatic animals here. Different types of Corals and specimens of shells of snails and other molluscan are also seen. Most of the specimens are collected from areas in and around Andaman and Nicobar islands. Basically you get an insight into the rich marine life of these islands.

title: All activities here are suspended. It's just a jetty for boats now.
review_text: The sports complex here is shut down. This is where you board your boats for Ross and North Bay Islands. Nothing else special here except for the large jetty arrangement.

title: Nice collection of fish and marine life
review_text: It was a journey starter for us. The place restricts photography and has amazing specimens of fishes and marine life.

title: good place for kids
review_text: they display different types of corals and a small room with few aquariums.. must visit for school going kids...

title: Travel in Park and Aquarium
review_text: Marina Park and Aquarium is in Delanipur, Port Blair.. We can reach by walk from Aberdeen bazar. The park is neatly maintained and the travellers can spend their time in ease.It is open for the public from 6-00 AM to 10-00 PM. A Tsunami memorial is established here.

title: Beautiful Place for Family and Kids
review_text: It is a nice place to visit at Port Blair, as you get to see various species of fish and there is a park for kids too. The aquariums are small but your kids will love them for witnessing the beautiful aquatic life that they might not have witnessed before.

title: Marina Park and Aquarium
review_text: lot of fish and aquatic life , corals can be seen here . fully air conditioned . a nice place to visit . Monday is holiday

title: Good place to walk after your Ross visit
review_text: I found the place good mainly because of kids who had some play area and also a good stroll for couples. There are some good statues, artifacts from 1971 WAR, Navy turrets etc which may not be great but still worth a view. The walk by the sea in late evening is very good

title: Good spot to spend time
review_text: Options of walking park, traffic park for kids, adventure sports, adjacent to Aberdeen jetty for service to Ross Island and North Bay

title: Pretty basic
review_text: The fee is low. And the collection in this museum is mostly dead specimens in jars. There are some aquariums with saltwaterfish that actually look quite good - but the layout is nothing you might see in true aquariums. But for the money you pay there is not much to say.

title: Nice place to visit
review_text: clean and Nice place to visit for family trips and evening or morning walk near by city center . also play ground for childrens

title: Good Museum
review_text: You can see the corals here in this museum as well. plan a visit while you are there in the Port Blair.

title: Good visit
review_text: Good place to see all the aquatic animals in the aquariums. Though its a small place but very informative.

title: Not much to see
review_text: For the little entrance fee that you pay here, you cannot complain. It is a small exhibition of mostly preserved items. The aquariums are very small and don´t show anything special. In less than half an hour you have seen everything and you know not much more about the underwaterworld of Andaman islands.

title: Glance at the marine life of the Andamans
review_text: The fisheries museum gets you a glimpse of several marine creatures from in and around Andaman. Some of the aquatic animals which are unique to Andaman and Nicobar archipelago can be seen here. The place is not very big. You can cover all the displays within 30 minutes of time.

title: Marina Park and Aquarium
review_text: Marina Park and Aquarium is a beautiful place as one can see various kinds of fishes and other water animals, specially the children's will have fun and joy here.

title: Average
review_text: Visited with family and there is nothing exciting or spectacular of mention here. Though they have taken efforts to maintain the aquarium the choices of aquatic animals you get to see are very few and chance for the kids to learn or expereince aquatic life is non existent. You can walk in and out in 20mins flat. We have visited good aquariums before and IMO this is not worth the effort.

title: Must-see
review_text: Best aquarium i have ever seen. Variety is vast and very well maintained. Clean and beautiful. must visit attraction.

title: Nothing much to see here!!
review_text: go only if you have nothing else to do or if you are really interested in sea life. The visit needs hardly 40-45 mins.

title: Must visited place.
review_text: we visited on 22-12-2016 with a group of 7 persons. Very neat and clean environment. This is also a historical place and you can see our historical chapter and monument of our brave ????.

title: Best scenic view
review_text: Best scenic view on the way to & fro from Wandoor to Jolyboy Island. Glass bottom boat ride is recommended.

title: Variety of Beautiful fishes
review_text: Worth to visit. Just 10 bucks for entry. Can visit the place in 20-30 minutes. Lot of beautiful fishes and corals. Good place to take kids.

title: Not an aquarium, its more of a museum
review_text: There are no live marine creatures to see here. Variety of fishes and other marine animals can be seen preserved in glass bottles in formalin solution. Going to this place with lot of hope will certainly be disappointing. One can watch the preserved creatures but definitely not witness marine life in action.

title: Know their Sea
review_text: This museum is near Wandoor beach and we visited it enroute Jolly Buoy island. Nothing much to see but a time pass. The replicas marine animals are as good as original. Not very time consuming. A good place to spent time before the scheduled boat departure for Jolly Buoy island Great variety of colorful sea creatures preserved in glass bottle where the original is available instead of the replica.

title: Its a place where you can relax
review_text: Marina park is a beautiful place, we went there in the evening and found full of people. We found local people are also gathered over there.

title: Watching dead creatures is not very appealing
review_text: This place has a collection of marine life from in and around Andaman and Nicobar Islands, kept in glass bottles in preservative solutions. Great variety of colorful fishes, snails, sea creatures living in shells, lobsters, star fish, crabs etc. can be seen here. It's not that appealing to watch dead marine animals. Having proper aquariums with living marine creatures would be more fascinating.

title: VERY RARE AQUA MARINE FISHES ARE COLLECTED
review_text: we can see very rare kind of marine fishes and species at this marine park . lot of information and details can be collected in this park. you may visit this marine park before going for scuba diving or snorkeling and can relate tyour viewing...

title: Beautiful museum. Must visit !!
review_text: The museum is very well maintained. You will get to see various types of corals and sea anemone skeletons.Also they have a small souvenir shop from where you can buy stuffs. Good place for family and kids.

title: Watch the collection of Marine life in Andamans
review_text: The fisheries museum has a great collection of aquatic life in and around Andaman Islands. As this is a museum and not an aquarium, we could see only the preserved creatures in glass jars. Several kinds of Fishes, Molluscs, Crabs etc. can be seen here.

title: Well maintained
review_text: Located on the silent shores of south Andamans, this is a well maintained aqua park by Indian Navy (I didn't know until I visited). The location itself is beautiful and serene, to add to that is this nice educative attraction. Don't miss!

title: OK for one time visit - nothing much to see if u have seen real corals
review_text: OK for one time visit - nothing much to see if u have seen real corals at North Bay/ Elephant beach/ Jolly Buoy island. A typical marine museum and an attached Samudrika govt owned stall selling marine items.

title: Ok ok place
review_text: Its good to spend little time here to improve your knowledge regarding marine life. The place is close to city or i must say within the city so no problem to get in here.

title: Good place to see some rare marine species
review_text:
The Fisheries museum is located very close to the Rajiv Gandhi Sports Complex and houses a variety of rare marine species like fishes, reptiles and shells. 
The place is small but well maintained. 
Would have loved to see live species instead of the dead ones kept in jars :(

title: Portrayal of Marine life of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
review_text:
The Fisheries Museum is located close to the Rajiv Gandhi Water Sports complex. 
It has several specimens of Fishes and other marine creatures found in and around the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. 

The different marine animals are preserved in glass jars in preservatives. There is good collection of corals, crabs, starfish and variety of fishes. 

Photography is not allowed in the this museum.

title: Not a great place to visit, too expensive
review_text: I went here hearing from lot of visitors. But it was very expensive. I did not like that much. Just go and ghave a view, if you have lot of free time.

title: Horrifying to see dead fishes
review_text: We visited the site in Feb 15. Not a nice experience to see dead fishes in jar with some liquid chemical. I just wanted to finish it at earliest. If you have no issue in seeing dead fishes in jar than you may enjoy.

title: Good to Spend Little Time
review_text: This museum has displayed a large variety of fish. It is just a small ancient aquarium and represents the marine life. Several steps are to be taken to improve this museum. It is closed on all Mondays, Public Holidays and Second Saturdays. The ticket is also very low cost. Visit during your spare time.

title: The All Time Loved Place
review_text: The Marina Park is one of the best spots for everyone whether local or tourists visiting Andaman Island. In Marina Park, There is a Rajiv Gandhi Water Sports Complex from which the small boats and ferries operate between the Ross Island, North Bay Island and Viper Island. There were many water activities and boat rides take place here such as banana boat ride, jet ski ride, speed boat ride, etc. Peoples can visit here at all the times and all days. it is the best spot for all age groups to relax and enjoy their leisure time.

title: Needs maintenance and care
review_text: This is may good for tourist if it is maintained well with due care .. poor maintenance Leeds it's to unwished. . Have something but poor attraction.. anyhow with shrinking heart I have visited this .. ok

title: Visit at Leisure, nothing to die for.
review_text: Many variety of fish are there but presentation is poor. The place needs a face-lift. Ancient aquariums. Poor lighting. Unattractive. Cannot be said to be well maintained. Someone needs to take steps to mordenize the place. Visit only in spare time.

title: Very little things to see
review_text: This is just a small aquarium for viewing with very limited options to see and hence the ticket is also priced very economically. Cannot compare it to the one's is Dubai or Singapore so if you visit it, dnt have high expectations

title: Awesome place
review_text: The real nature is here. Sight seeing and spending the best time with ur loved ones would be here and no where else.

title: GOOD VIIST
review_text: Good visit, a man made park and jettys, worth a visit , small eateries abound on the road next to the park.

title: Government run efficient Museum
review_text: The place is run by the Fisheries department of Andaman & Nicobar Government. The place is a little dull since it is a museum( not an aquarium) with lot of preserved marine life in bottle jars. The museum takes lunch break for an hour . Be careful to check timing. All the same it is educative place and need not be missed if you have time. Think of the amounts you have to pay for entry at SEA aquarium,Sentosa compared to Rs 10 you pay at this museum.

title: An Interesting Museum and Aquariu m
review_text:
This has now become more of an Aquarium, so apart from the vast variety of live fish there is also a variety of preserved marine life in jars and collections of Coral and shells on display. The display boards are both informative and interesting. 

The grounds of the museum are well kept and the building itself is brightly painted with yellow, pink and blue colouring. There is a life size model of a whale on display opposite the entrance giving you some idea of the enormity of these great creatures. 

Whilst there is much the same displayed in the Naval museum, this one merits a visit on its own.

title: lovely aquarium
review_text: its pretty cool and lovely aquarium small but well organised aquarium with lots of corals and fishes specimens.

title: A museum for name's sake
review_text: The place has a shabby collection of marine life, most of which is stored in jars full of formalene solution. The place could smell better. Not a very good place to visit except if you are bored out of your minds and would go for anything.

title: Excellant place
review_text: I was overjoyed to see the various collection of coral reefs, shells and all such stuff. It's a sort of must-visit place.

title: Please avoid - prefer Samudrika Museum over this for better experience of same area
review_text:
1. Most fishes are dead and kept in Jars with preservatives 
2. Very small and poorly maintained 
3. Only 10-15 LIVE fishes

title: Great place for getting a look into the marine life of Andamans
review_text: One can get a good overview of marine life with somewhat elaborate collection of corals & variety of fishes.

title: GOOD COLLECTION OF CORALS AND SHELLS
review_text: The Museum has a very good collection of corals and shells with labelled classification of them which is interesting. It also has a Preserved Saw- fish. However the collection of Live Fishes and Aquariums is disappointing.

title: to get knowlege about marine life
review_text: various type of corals marine life to understand. very knowledgeable to understand. a small time is required to understand

title: Waste of time
review_text: Its very small and does not have anything out of the ordinary to offer. Visit if you do not have anything else planned.

title: Interesting
review_text: The museum gives a good overview of marine life with a good collection of corals & a variety of fishes.

title: The Fishery Museum
review_text: It is a museum with huge collection of corals, shells, clams and fishes. Though the collection of live fish is less. It is located close to Rajiv Gandhi water sports complex. One-time visit is a must.

title: Not so Good
review_text: Quality and quantity of Live fishes was very very less. Can be upgraded with more varieties of it. You won't miss much if not visited.

title: Good park but not aquarium
review_text: Park is OK to have some leisure time spent, but the visit to the aquarium was a despair. Limited varieties of fishes available in it.

title: A real beach side Park..
review_text: The name really suggests it! I loved the quite park and the board walk. It's the best place to watch the sunset and enjoy the calming sound of the sea. I would really suggest going here at the evening, to enjoy the walk and not the sun. But if you are there to visit the aquarium, do visit in the morning, they are closed after 5.

title: Good view
review_text: We visited there late at evening. However enjoyed the walking on the bridge in the sea. Feeling was amazing when we walk on the bridge. Everywere was sea and its waves were hitting the bridge where we're walking.

title: Nothing great- Skip it and you wont regret
review_text: Located near Water Sports Complex in Port Blair, this museum has nothing much to offer. It has a varied collection of fishes, shells, corals etc. However, the overall look and ambience is not that great.

title: Don't expect too much
review_text: Just an average place . Few here and there places.Just roam around if you have nothing to do. Just take few pics around and feel the sea shore with coconut water in your hand. Boat facility is also there.

title: Average, can be skipped
review_text: If you have already visited the Samudrika Naval musuem, then this Fisheries musuem maintained by the government may seem a tad boring. It is not well maintained and does not allow any form of pohotography which are the negatives. However it does have few good fish species and a god collection of shells and corals. So if you have time at your hand do go else the Samudrika is good enough ...

title: Nice
review_text:
Fishery Museum... 
Located very much in the city , easily approachable 
Vast collection of Aquatic animal .. 
time pass... 
but should visit once to see the variety of aquatic animal

title: marina park
review_text: good park accessible to all personal no entry fee and during eving this place look like haven it is very good to visit once

title: Not great ... but worth a visit
review_text: The Fisheries museum in the heart of the Port blair city is a Govt owned museum which has a wide collection of fishes, corals and shells maintained in a single story hall. Photography is not allowed which is a negative but the collection of fishes and shells makes it worth a visit. Opens at 9 am till 4 pm

title: Good collection of aquatic life
review_text:
You will see all types of fishes, sea horse, other sea creatures in this museum. 
Good from knowledge point of view.

title: "Time pass"
review_text: Nice place to visit. Can also do some shopping There are lot of different things are showcased to buy.

title: Good place to learn the fauna!
review_text: The fisheries museum is an excellent place to learn and know about the vast and diverse fauna of Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Apart form numerous shells, skeleton of 20 feet Sperm Whale is awesome.

title: kids may like it
review_text: Small kids who like to watch different types of fishes can be taken there. good for spending !/2 hour time of your trip

title: Rainy day activity
review_text: This aquarium is located while going to abreedn bazaar from jail. its a good activity to perfrom in rainy season.

title: Good fish Museum
review_text: This museum having no of types of fishes kept here with lot's off information once you can visit if you have extra time.

title: Timepass Aquarium
review_text: FISHERY MUSEUM is average to visit.It is a timepass.Here one can see some types of aquatic except tortoise.

title: Pretty average!
review_text: This would be pretty average, compared to lots of other aquariums that you can get round the world. Considering that this is a major tourist destination, and the abundance of sea life around Andamans, they could have set a nice one here, which would have attracted tourists in dozens! I have seen quite a few aquariums around the world, and need to say, this one needs improvement. There are some interesting ones and species of sea life, but very limited!

title: Good
review_text: Nice place to visit. Can also do some shopping here of stuff made of sea shells and other similar items

title: Buyers Spot
review_text: It's a buyers spot. There are lot of different things are showcased to buy. All of those are made by the island peoples. Reasonable price for mementos.

title: A Place of Marine Life
review_text: We see different types of fishes and corals in the museum. They do not allow us to take photographs of the fishes and corals.

title: Museum of Marine Life
review_text: Lot of marine spices are found in the museum. Many of them are in stuffed condition. A film show of marine life is also play in the auditorium.

title: Fishes and corals
review_text: Had very less time hence were not able to spend much time however sperm whale skeleton and so much variety... great

title: Good to see the Fishes and coral
review_text: The name of museum is "Aquarium" under Department of Fisheries. There are wonderful collection of Corals, Shells, Conchs, Giant Clams and some good variety of Fishes. The ambiance is good but the number of Fish species on display is very limited. There is a good number of bottled marine life, but it hardly attracts the attention of lay persons. The location is very good (near Sports complex) so that you can always squeeze some time for the visit. The coral collection is very good

title: superb place to see desert island
review_text: beautiful place to see white beaches, nice coral reefs- unfortunatelly damaged by tsunami, the ony problem is that you have to take your water in provided flasks- reusabled

title: One time visit
review_text: Good, well equipped, well staffed place, included in city tour.....learning, photo shoots, relaxing in the ac (after scorched by sun god during the tour) & finally the cold drinks in the canteen just outside. ..were the highlights. Go, if you have to.

title: Aberdeen Jetty-Launches and boats Service to Ross And North Bay Island
review_text:
The Aberdeen Jetty is a part of Marina Park near water sport complex of Port Blair, where launches and boats are available to the Ross and North Bay Island. Island tourist boat operator association looks about the works here. The system works here is in a well organized manner. The boat name is clearly mentioned on the ticket, departure and arrival timing is also mentioned on the ticket. Announcements were made in mike when the boat arrives. Passenger names are called out. So there is no need to rush and run towards the entrance of the Jetty. My tour operator arranges the ticket and brings me here at 9:00 am. At correct time boat comes to the jetty and we board M.V. Island Waves boat. For safety life jackets provided to all persons and overloading of boats than maximum capacity is not allowed. A guide type person comes and gives instruction about how to wear life jacket then tell about Coral Bay Island and what activity can be done there. I and my wife choose to use glass bottom boat so about 9:55am we were shifted to glass bottom boat for 20 to 30 minute ride to see under water coral life through glass bottom boat. The tourist included my son who chooses other activity like Sea walking and snookering were directly taken to the North Bay Island. After enjoying all activity at North Bay Island at 12:00 we board... The Aberdeen Jetty is a part of Marina Park near water sport complex of Port Blair, where launches and boats are available to the Ross and North Bay Island. Island tourist boat operator association looks about the works here. The system works here is in a well organized manner. The boat name is clearly mentioned on the ticket, departure and arrival timing is also mentioned on the ticket. Announcements were made in mike when the boat arrives. Passenger names are called out. So there is no need to rush and run towards the entrance of the Jetty. 
My tour operator arranges the ticket and brings me here at 9:00 am. At correct time boat comes to the jetty and we board M.V. Island Waves boat. For safety life jackets provided to all persons and overloading of boats than maximum capacity is not allowed. A guide type person comes and gives instruction about how to wear life jacket then tell about Coral Bay Island and what activity can be done there. I and my wife choose to use glass bottom boat so about 9:55am we were shifted to glass bottom boat for 20 to 30 minute ride to see under water coral life through glass bottom boat. The tourist included my son who chooses other activity like Sea walking and snookering were directly taken to the North Bay Island. 
After enjoying all activity at North Bay Island at 12:00 we board our boat and after about half an hour journey we reaches Ross Island. Remains of high class past were looking in the ruins buildings. At 2:30 pm we were called on the boat that brings back to Aberdeen Jetty. 
Tickets counter is here. Different types of tour ticket like full day tour to North Bay Island. Full Day tour to Ross Island or round the tour Aberdeen jetty to North Bay Island, North Bay to Ross Island and back to Jetty. We can choose according to availability of time. 

Private ferry service running from Aberdeen Jetty to North Bay and Ross Island. 
It will take around 15 to 20 minutes to reach the North Bay Island. 
It will take around 15 to 20 minutes to reach the Ross Island. More

title: NOTHING SPECIAL HERE
review_text: The fishes are kept preserved in small bottles and so its not view able, More of specimens than alive one. Could be good if they could have more number of live fishes.

title: fishery museum
review_text: Only if you have lot of time on hand, you may visit this. ok. / no doubt,you may see it once.But if hardpressed for time, forget it.

title: well maintained and equipped
review_text: it is well maintained and all the stuff kept is interesting. there is a video which goes on and is well documented. 1 hr is good to spend here.

title: Fisheries Museum-Collection of marine welth
review_text:
Situated near Rajiv Gandhi Water Sports Complex, Port Blair, it exhibits species of marine life endemic to the Islands and Bay of Bengal. Many species of marine life have been very carefully preserved in this Museum. Variety of corals found in Andman displayed here. Oyster with pearl, giant calm (tridacna sp.) different types of shell, huge saw fish and shark teeth are the main attraction to see. 
Timing: 9.00AM to 1.00PM, 2.00PM to 4.45PM, Closed on Mondays and Public holidays/second 
Saturday. 
Entry Fee: Adult Rs.5/-, Child Rs.3/-, video without focus light: Rs.35/- 
Ph.03192-231848.

title: Fishes and Corals
review_text: Very interesting and enjoyable museum if interested in Marine Life. It has has different variety of fish and Corals that are showcased.

title: Small but informative
review_text: Hardly a 10 mins tour it is a small Aquarium with most of the sea form preserved in chroloform rather than alive, nevertheless they house baby sea turtles, variety of fishes, and other marine life which would otherwise be difficult to see. A special mention is the skeleton of the whale outside!!

title: near to nature and aqua life
review_text:
the park and the govt aquarium are places of interest to those who love torelax and who like to watch aqua life and also learn historical evolution of fossils and coral reefs. 
there is an entry fee and the visit should not take much time.

title: Average
review_text: Good visit, but the variety of fishes are too less, tickers are cheap and can be completed in couple of hours. Can be visited during city tour.

title: One time visit place
review_text:
it is near port blair water sports complex 
it is open excluding indian holidays, nice to see sea animals found in near andaman sea coasts , fees are very affordable. 

it is renovated in november 2014

title: must watch
review_text: Science center is a must visit place in port blair, depicts the large and different size and type of coral, fish. Gives the knowledge of sea world. Gives the idea of living style of the famous andaman nicobar tribals such as Jaarwas, Sentinels etc

title: Average aquarium
review_text: It is an average aquarium.Nothing to write home about.If you have seen Dubai Mall Aquarium or Siam Paragon aquarium in Bangkok or Under water world in Langkawi, this is is nothing.

title: Excellent aquarium
review_text: A well maintained aquarium, you can almost see all types if salt water fisher here.There is a hughe whale skeleton placed out side the museum.Good one to see

title: Fish
review_text: Variety of fish was good. Should just visit to relax and watch fish, will definitely go again. Park is good for walk.

title: very less collection
review_text: the collection is mostly in aquariums and jar stored. nothing in comparison to the life-like aquariums we have in most of sea spots like Langkawi or any other place.

title: just aswome,
review_text: total fish world can be seen in this museum, big fish small fish, turtles, different types of fishesh with the andaman safar on projector too, the whales skull is situated there on the ntrance of the museum very beautiful!

title: Ok to visit
review_text: If you have time, then only visit. else better off to directly go to islands and do snorkelling to view the natural fauna of andamans. it has some good collections of Sea fishes and some animals.

title: small museum
review_text: small museum at water sports complex.little to see.you ll like it only if you are a research type of person

title: Insight on fishes
review_text: The best part of this place is that we get to see real Coral reefs and Oysters containing pearls in them. Also, many rare types of fish in different shapes.

title: Creatures of Underwater World
review_text: I was staying in a lodge uphill from this place and from the window, i had a majestic view of the sea,aberdeen jetty,Netaji Stadium, the Aquirium and Marina Park.I had an early breakfast and decided to walk to this place.I reached this aquirium quite early and waited for the Authorities to open it to public.You have to pay a fees to gain entry and no cameras are allowed inside the aquirium.The aquirium is not that large and is housed in an average building.They have many types of life fishes,shells ,corals,sea urchins and undersea creatures in aquiriums.There are also preserved inhabitants of sea in jars and bottles.The most remarkable item I saw was huge conches, as big as 2 footballs combined placed at the reception area.Well, there is nothing of much interests to see, if you have ample time then can pay a visit. More

title: Visit
review_text: Nothing great to write home about. Although centrally located it is no patch on Samudrika, the museum maintained by the Indian Navy. The souvenir shop is over priced.

title: Take it with the Cellular Jail and Watersport complex
review_text: On the way from the Cellular jail to the Water sport Park . Pleasant way to spend half an hour . Nice souvenir shop of Aniidco near the entry . Nominal entry charge . Closed on Monday .

title: informative place
review_text: a glimpse of rich marine life of andaman sea, v neat an clean place maintained by local administration word of praise for that

title: Good place to spend couple of hours almost any time of day
review_text: Its a well maintained park and aquarium. Its a pretty photogenic place so plan to visit in daylight :) This park is with sea facing and you can even enjoy simple walk here.

title: Good place to spend couple hours
review_text: Its a nice place to spend couple hours. You can plan for it if you don't have much else to do or not enough time to do anything else.

title: Nice View and wind
review_text:
Its a good place to be in the eve and early mornings. 
air is so fresh here. you will love the view of island from this location. 
Entry is free for the park. For aquarium you need to take a ticket 10 Rs. Good stuff and very rare fish species can be seen.

title: Well maintained
review_text: It is a very well maintained park and museum. You can spend a lazy evening here. Just next to the Jetty to Ross island.

title: Excellent sea view
review_text: The very first thing to notice is the cleaniness of the place. The sea view in the evening with lights visible at distance places is awesome. Sea breeze n walk to Aberdeen Jetty is wonderful.

title: nice place
review_text:
crab,lobster,squid, 
prown,and variety of fishes are there waiting for the visitors.the foods are so good . 
the park is also beautiful.one can see different types of fish there.

title: Plaze for Evening Leisure Time
review_text: Visit Marina Park and Aquarium on early morning or evening. Can see and learn about various corals and fish species. Recommended to visit it prior to your Scuba Dive (if planning for one).

title: Can see some live sea creatures
review_text: Its is a small but well maintained aquarium - partly live and partly non-live corals and sea animals in preserve bottles. It gives you glimpses of various corals available in the islands and sea creatures. The live big lobster is a must see item. Should not miss this place. The place closes between 1 to 2PM for lunch. Ideally you can have lunch in the nearby Light House Café and then visit this place.

title: Similar to a laboratory
review_text: Below average place. It appears more like a laboratory with various fish species kept in small bottles with liquid preservatives. There are a few aquariums also which are pretty decent. Visit only if you have spare time. Certainly not a priority.

title: Nice for kids
review_text: Its ok time pass place..good for the kids to see ...its near by the jail ..so u can utilise the time from 1630 to 1730 hrs...

title: Average Place!
review_text: Good to visit but does not have a lot of stuff. It should have had more live specimens. The museum is small, will take hardly about an hour to cover everything.

title: great place for kids
review_text: kids love to watch beautiful shells , corals and fishes in aquarium and this place offers everything they want. this is air conditioned so comfortable in the heat also

title: Museum?? Pathetic.
review_text:
Please do not take the pain to visit this place as it is near cellular jail. Go there only if you want to see how badly and painfully the fishes have been jammed and crammed into small jars. All the fish and marine life have lost their color. You cannot tell the difference between any 2 fish, they have been so badly kept. Totally pathetic and a waste of time ! 
Please DO-visit the Marine Museum "Samudrika". Lovely fish, coral, shells and many varieties of marine life preserved there with much grace.

title: Tag along...
review_text: The Aquarium has good collections...it is near the jetty for Ross Island and can be peaked into post Ross Island visit...

title: So so
review_text: I have been to a lot of such museums and this visit left me wanting. The place looks underfunded and understaffed

title: More like a laboratory
review_text: This is not a very interesting and enjoyable museum according to me. It seems more like a laboratory with various types of fishes kept in small bottles with liquid preservatives. There are some aquariums also present at this place which are good but the same are also displayed at the 'Samudrika museum' which is very good compared to this museum. I would advise travelers that they can skip this museum & visit 'Samudrika museum' (in Port Blair itself) so that they can use this time to explore other interesting places in Port Blair.

title: Good plae to Visit for Young Children
review_text: The museum is nice plae to visit. Good Fishes on Display. Children just loved the Fishes. All smiles after Visit.

title: For time pass only
review_text: The aquarium has an Ok collection of live sea animals and preserved ones. But absolutely nothing has been done to present the collection in an interesting way. It is just placed one after the other. The entry fee is Rs. 5. You can just check out the place if you're in the neighbourhood, want to kill time/want to keep your kids a little occupied.

title: zoology department in a college
review_text: waste of time...this is not what I expected,, my college had better collection of specimens in bottles..skip this..

title: Don't was time with a visit to this place
review_text: Spending time in beaches are the best things to do when you are in Andaman islands. There are better aquariums elsewhere.

title: Marina park and auarium visit
review_text: Aquarium though small but intersting see varities.Marina park with Rajiv and Netaji statue and good laid path for walkers worth spending time in the evening. Traffic park nearby is useful for schoolgoing children. Park is very neat unlike in west/south.

title: Only if you have nothing else to do!
review_text: Picture this - desperation to get the tickets to enter the Cellular Jail - you get to the ticket counter early. Ticket received ages in advance you don't know what to do - with the time on hand. Make a visit to the Marina Park (only if you have got time on your hands). Have a look at the variety of sea life. And head back asap!

title: Nice collection.
review_text: A nice place to know under water life. They have pretty good collection. But I liked the Samudrika more than this one.

title: very nice museum
review_text:
we visited this place during our trip to Andaman trip 
the stuff here is breathtaking. 
but it is short trip 
you finish seeing everything in about 30 mins

title: Visit this only if you want to enhance your GK about aquatic life
review_text: Very averagely placed collection of old aquatic life samples, nothing fascinating or interesting. Took us only 15-20 minutes to go round the entire museum.

title: Don't go to this one
review_text: It's a waste of time. Who would like to see Fishes and other animals in Formaldehyde bottles. It took just 5 mins to come out of this one. If your tour itinerary has it, get it changed.

title: dont expect to much
review_text:
this is a good way to kill 15mins there are a few fish in the aquarium you would 
be better of booking a diving trip

title: Nice place
review_text: Different kinds of coral are shown there, but the live fish aquariums are very good. I personally liked the Bat fish and clicked photos with here

title: Needs improvement
review_text: Requires some more staff and guides to educate the visitors. The building is well designed and maintained, however, the floors are slippery during rains.

title: Not much to see
review_text: Its a total waste of time and money. Not much to see. You can go and come out within 10 mins. Avoid if u dnt have much time.

title: Aquarium Port Blair
review_text: A good collection of Andaman marine biota is exhibited here in a scientific way. The living ones like the clown and stone fishes are the crowd pullers. Adjoining restaurant cooks delectable sea food to your choice and burns a hole in pockets.

title: poor cousin to samudrika
review_text: if you are planning to make a trip to the naval samudrika museum, you can easily skip this. although entry fee is nominal, the display is second grade as compared to the other. both in terms of variety and style. however, if you are trying to finish port blair in a day and wish to save time then being close to both the cellular jail & the jetty used for ross island visits, this will prove a quicker bet.

title: Lots of fish!
review_text: Fisheries museum has a few dead and a few live fishes. I'm not a good reviewer for fish - but I can tell you it has a sperm whale skeleton at the entrance, is on one single floor and is located close to the water sports complex. A large hall houses aquariums, and one more houses dead things preserved in formaldehyde inside bottles. The aquariums are not large enough to have any large fishes - say 4/5 feet across. Worth a visit, if you're close by or alternatively, if you're crazy about fish.

title: Horrible, depressing, please avoid
review_text: Going by the name, we assumed that this was an "aquarium", with lot of sea-animals and marine life. It turned out to be a depressing formalin lab. The marine animals are stuffed into jars filled with formalin. As a result, they have all lost color and have acquired a ghostly look. Very depressing place and certainly not what is expected from an "Aquarium". Please avoid!

title: More informatics about Sea World
review_text:
To know more about the under sea world is really wonderful to visit this place. Several Corals, Fishes, Snakes, etc exists 

under sea is really wonder to being informatics.

title: Pretty good ... clean aquarium !
review_text: Photography is not allowed inside, though, there were tourists who believe to be smart, were taking photos. The collection of corals and fishes is good and this is a Must visit place, if you have not visited any aquariums outside India. Easily, one can complete this in 30-40 minutes time.

title: Aquarium
review_text: Not that much attractive. Its just opposite to Cellular Jail. Most of the sea specious are kept in formalin and hence not impressive

title: 15 min visit
review_text: go to get some info on corals and fishes you can see in the andaman seas. We saw more variety of fishes and coral in the jolly buoy glass bottom ride . The aquarium hardly has 2 rooms with very few fishes and exhibits. Not impressive :(

title: Educational
review_text: The kids would really love to see it.It is like treasure if you are interested in marine life.Lots of sample of marine species.Very good informative literature.I personally learnt about the flying fish & hermit crabs which i was fortunate enough to see on the beach @ havelock island & Neil island

title: Avg. aquarium
review_text:
Some common fishes to be seen & lots of preserved or skeletons of rare marine animals. Also the 'no photo' rule is bit negative....photo without flash could be allowed. This aquarium gets 3 star as it's certain better maintained than Mumbai aquarium. 
if one is not going for scuba dive or has been just hurried up during the dive, visit to this place could fill up the gap

title: OK.
review_text: You get to see sea flora fauna. Its good for children provided they have interest and willing to listen

title: Poorly maintained
review_text: Entry gate says its an aquarium, but all you will see is formalin-preserved fishes that are wrongly identified. Don't Andaman Fisheries Dept have some fish taxonomists? Seaweeds are all wrong too, and funniest part is that the labels of bottle covers the entire bottle so that no one can see contents inside. One bottle reads "Halimeda" and describes full taxonomic hierarchy and the label covers everything except a small portion in the botton where you will see a white liquid! Actual halimeda is golden brown fan like, one of the prettiest seaweeds, but this museum will make you hate all aquatic life. Terrible experience, please dont go there to hate marine biology! More

title: Get a feel of sea spices.
review_text: Anything to do with the sea is fascinating. The giant clam shells, the corals, sword fish. And as everywhere in these islands, friendly people.

title: fishery Museum
review_text: Nice Clean place. Good for the school going children. I think the shopping here is bit more expensive. Cost of bigger range perhaps!!!!

title: For later
review_text: Go there if you have the time after visiting the other attractions. It is not too large. Different kinds of coral are exhibited though, but the live fish aquariums fail to impress.

title: Go to samudrika instead
review_text: the fisheries museum is not worth your time. the items on exhibit are similar to that in samudrika. The rest seems like a science lab.

title: Fisheries museum
review_text: This is in Port Blair and one must go and see the variety of fishes available in the sea and at different depths.

title: Nice collection of underwater life.
review_text: It has very excellent and rare collection of fishes and other sea creatures. They had kept their bodies in preserving liquid and had described everything so well. They son't allow photography inside but you can record video, this thing make me strainge. Overall good place for enrich knowledge of underwater life if you are interested.

title: Excellent -Saw live undersea animals
review_text:
Excellent -Saw live undersea animals 
Very well maintained. Explanation found near the exhibit. 
Children and adults both would enjoy this

title: Good collection of fishes
review_text: A good collection of fishes. No photography allowed. A better way to understands the marine life of the island. A must see for all the fellow travelers.

title: Just too small
review_text: This aquarium is a nice attempt to bring the public attention to sea life. Unfortunately it is very small and contains very few aquariums with living fishes. So it worth a visit with very young kids or adults who never saw any other aquarium. Otherwise just don't try

title: A excellent place to begin your tour
review_text:
This is one place where you should begin your Andaman tour. It gives a first hand account of the sea life and by the time you end, you would be familiar with a lot of sea life. 
Now, when you are on a glass bottom boat or snorkeling or may be sea walking and you come across a lot of marine life, you would rejoice to see them live under sea.

title: Deserves a short stopover
review_text:
Located just besides the Rajiv Gandhi water sport complex, one can spend a short while here. 
Has a good collection of all the varieties of corals. 
In the courtyard is a skeleton of a sperm whale.

title: few dead & preserved marine life
review_text: again one more place where you can kill your time. specially places in portblair are not worth to spend more time there only few things which gives you some knowledge on marine life. you should be thankful to local tour operator who made these places are popular to just make money.

title: A very small place...
review_text: As I expected a bigger aqua museum I was a bit disappointed... Ok and it will take just 10 to 15 min .. so just have a look and dont need to specially plan.... nd also can skip samudrika after you visit this place....

title: Good place for honeymooners and children.
review_text: We can learn lot of species here. Maintences are little less, but that fine... Spend ur 1 hr here. And than move on.

title: Smaller Than Samudrika
review_text: If you plan to be at Samudrika - skip this. Or again, 15 minutes is all the time this will take. So decide what to do. Nothing great here after you have been to Samudrika.

title: Good Museum
review_text: This museum helps us to increase our knowledge on under-water life of Andaman & Nokobar Island. We see several Corals, Fishes and Snakes.

title: Give Samudrika a Miss and go here.
review_text:
Everything at Samudrika is here and more. 

So its better than samudrika. 

Saw fishes. lots of fishes. tigger fish. lion fish. cucumber fish. clams. octopus. corals. lot of fishes. lot of snake specimens.

title: Balas Aquarium visit
review_text: This aquarium displays various types of fish also some other sea animals such as corals, shells etc. Aquarium comprises varieties of live fish also dead preserved for sea animal lovers to go through and increase thier awareness. There is a small shop selling shells, souveneirs and we purchased a porcelain mug in remembrance of our visit to this Museum.

title: Very small aquarium.
review_text: You can be in and out in 10-15 minutes because the aquarium is very small. Not huge variety but some beautiful and small fishes are there. They have some variety of sea corals and shells as well. The ticket is as cheap as 10 bucks and in this price air condition is really good.

title: Corals, Corals and more Corals
review_text: As my heading says, this place is full of under water stuff placed safely behind glasses. If you like it, you must go

title: Interesting Stop
review_text:
They have exibits about the sea, shells, history and indigenous people in welcomingly cool airconditioned rooms. 

The aquarium is tiny and sad if you are a diver. 

You cna be in and out in 15 minutes.

title: Beautiful view of harbor
review_text: Part of complex including multiple statues of leaders. Clearly central funds were put to use in building a nationalistic fervor around this area. Nice views, prime location but with sea waves crashing ashore during high tide is a stark reminder of after effects of Tsunami.

title: Representative of the rich marine wealth of Andaman
review_text: Like most other locations the tickets are priced very reasonably. Rs 5 and 3 for adult and children. Very good place to introduce kids to the marine life especially corals, unique fishes and fauna in and around A&N islands

title: Boring
review_text: If you are really interested in fishery, go scuba diving or snorkelling. You will have lot more fun then.

title: great pool of knowledge
review_text: A very nice Museum with a vast display of corals and sea creatures. Great place for kids to learn . And most intresting video graphy allowed .

title: An impressive collection of sea life
review_text:
Situated by the side of Rajiv Gandhi Sports Complex and about 1 KM from Cellular Jail - the museum has an impressive collection of sea life. Maintained very well and lively inside, the photography is prohibited so you get to see the display peacefully - without overenthusiastic crowd clicking meaningless snaps. 
There is also a good variety of Corals on display other than peculiar fishes, shells, crabs, turtles, sea horses, and what not. The place has a lot of large photographs, explaination on displays and other intersting material.

title: Fish and more
review_text: Anything to do with the sea is fascinating. The giant clam shells, the corals, the ?stuffed (now extinct) sword fish. And as everywhere in these islands, friendly people.

title: Fisheries museum An average site
review_text: Considering Andaman has a wide variety of Marine life this could have been a marvelous visit. Alas most of the specimens are bottled in Formaldehyde giving a feeling of Biological lab. Even though there is not much to show case they prohibit photography.

title: Disappointing
review_text: They charge if you want to take photographs but its a very small room and not all that great. There is a restaurant outside it from where I bought water for the trip and that was more useful

title: THE COLOURFUL AQUARIUM
review_text:
This museum is located near Cellular jail and next to new lighthouse restaurant.Timing 9.30am to 4.30pm.Entrance fee Rs5p/p.Photography not allowed.Closed on monday. 

This museum has displayed various types of fishes both dead and living,corals,shells etc.It is a small museum.Visit this place if you are really interested in marine life.On our first day we visited this place.We learned a lot about the fishes and corals.So on the next day when we went for snorkeling we knew most of the fishes which increased our excitement more.
